settingDescription: Specify the merge policy for exclusions. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined exclusions (merge) or only administrator-defined exclusions (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own exclusions.
name: exclusionsMergePolicy

settingDescription: Whether the antivirus engine runs in passive mode or not.
name: passiveMode

settingDescription: Antivirus engine enforcement mode
name: enforcementLevel

settingDescription: Whether cloud delivered protection is enabled on the device or not. To improve the security of your services, we recommend keeping this feature turned on.
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: enabled

settingDescription: Specifies the enforcement preference of antivirus engine. Real-time: Real-time protection (scan files as they're modified) is enabled. On-demand: Files are scanned only on demand and real-time protection is turned off. Passive: Runs the antivirus engine in passive mode.
name: enforcementLevel

settingDescription: Whether the antivirus engine runs behavior monitoring and blocking or not.
name: behaviorMonitoring

settingDescription: Specify the maximum number of number of threads used to perform the on demand scan.
name: maximumOnDemandScanThreads

settingDescription: Specify the number of days that results are retained in the scan history on the device. Old scan results are removed from the history. Old quarantined files that are also removed from the disk.
name: scanResultsRetentionDays

settingDescription: Whether the antivirus engine runs in passive mode or not.
name: passiveMode

settingDescription: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards supported
name: exclusions_item_name

settingDescription: Determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint is in blocking and scanning suspicious files.
name: cloudBlockLevel

settingDescription: Path to exclude, wildcards are NOT supported
name: exclusions_item_path

settingDescription: Specify the number of days that results are retained in the scan history on the device. Old scan results are removed from the history. Old quarantined files that are also removed from the disk.
name: scanResultsRetentionDays

settingDescription: List of threats (identified by their name) that are not blocked by the product and are instead allowed to run.
name: allowedThreats

settingDescription: If true, Defender will unpack archives and scan files inside them. Otherwise archive content will be skipped, that will improve scanning performance.
name: scanArchives

settingDescription: Type of the threat for which the behavior is configured.
name: threatTypeSettings_item_key

settingDescription: Specify the merge policy for threat type settings. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined settings (merge) or only administrator-defined settings (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own settings for different threat types.
name: threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy

settingDescription: Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified in the preceding section.
name: threatTypeSettings_item_value

settingDescription: Enables or disables file hash computation feature. When this feature is enabled Windows defender will compute hashes for files it scans. This will help in improving the accuracy of Custom Indicator matches. However, enabling Enable file hash computation may impact device performance.
name: enableFileHashComputation

settingName: Run a scan after definitions are updated
settingDescription: Specifies whether to start a process scan after new security intelligence updates are downloaded on the device. Enabling this setting will trigger an antivirus scan on the running processes of the device.
name: scanAfterDefinitionUpdate

settingDescription: Only one value per tag type can be set. Type of tags are unique, and should not be repeated in the same configuration profile.
name: tags_item_value

settingDescription: List of filesystems (identified by their name) to be unmonitored/excluded from Real Time Protection(RTP).
name: unmonitoredFilesystems

settingDescription: Specify the merge policy for threat type settings. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined settings (merge) or only administrator-defined settings (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own settings for different threat types.
name: threatTypeSettingsMergePolicy

settingDescription: Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected. The actions included in this list are not displayed in the user interface.
name: disallowedThreatActions

settingDescription: Path to exclude, wildcards are supported
name: exclusions_item_path

settingDescription: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards NOT supported
name: exclusions_item_name

settingDescription: Global exclusions apply to both Antivirus and Endpoint detection and response to exclude at a much lower level closer to sensors. Usage: Tackling performance issues. Risk: Significantly risks protection
name: exclusions

settingDescription: The threatTypeSettings preference in the antivirus engine is used to control how certain threat types are handled by the product.
name: threatTypeSettings

settingDescription: Directory if selected, or file if not selected
name: exclusions_item_isDirectory

settingDescription: Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected. The actions included in this list are not displayed in the user interface.
name: disallowedThreatActions

settingDescription: Diagnostic data is used to keep Microsoft Defender ATP secure and up-to-date, detect, diagnose and fix problems, and also make product improvements. This setting determines the level of diagnostics sent by the product to Microsoft.
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: diagnosticLevel

settingDescription: Specify a tag name and its value. The GROUP tag, tags the device with the specified value. The tag is reflected in the portal under the device page and can be used for filtering and grouping devices.
name: tags_item_key

settingDescription: List of threats (identified by their name) that are not blocked by the product and are instead allowed to run.
name: allowedThreats

settingDescription: Specify the merge policy for exclusions. This can be a combination of administrator-defined and user-defined exclusions (merge) or only administrator-defined exclusions (admin_only). This setting can be used to restrict local users from defining their own exclusions.
name: exclusionsMergePolicy

settingDescription: The threatTypeSettings preference in the antivirus engine is used to control how certain threat types are handled by the product.
name: threatTypeSettings

settingDescription: Directory if selected, or file if not selected
name: exclusions_item_isDirectory

settingDescription: Type of the threat for which the behavior is configured.
name: threatTypeSettings_item_key

settingDescription: Specify the maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history. Entries include all on-demand scans performed in the past and all antivirus detections.
name: scanHistoryMaximumItems

settingDescription: Entities that have been excluded from the scan. Exclusions can be specified by full paths, extensions, or file names.
name: exclusions

settingDescription: Whether the antivirus engine computes hashes for the files it scans or not.
name: enableFileHashComputation

settingDescription: Specifies whether to scan archives during on-demand antivirus scans.
name: scanArchives

settingDescription: Provides increased, faster protection with access to the latest protection data in the cloud. Works best with automatic sample submission turned on
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: enabled

settingDescription: Determines whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically:
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled

settingDescription: Sends sample files to Microsoft to help protect device users and your organization from potential threats
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: automaticSampleSubmissionConsent

settingDescription: Entities that have been excluded from the scan. Exclusions can be specified by full paths, extensions, or file names.
name: exclusions

settingDescription: Whether real-time protection (scan files as they are accessed) is enabled or not.
name: enableRealTimeProtection

settingDescription: Process name, either or full path or file name, wildcards supported
name: exclusions_item_name

settingDescription: Path to exclude, wildcards are supported
name: exclusions_item_path

settingName: Degree of parallelism for on-demand scans
settingDescription: Specifies the degree of parallelism for on-demand scans. This corresponds to the number of threads used to perform the scan and impacts the CPU usage, as well as the duration of the on-demand scan.
name: maximumOnDemandScanThreads

settingDescription: Specify the maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history. Entries include all on-demand scans performed in the past and all antivirus detections.
name: scanHistoryMaximumItems

settingDescription: Determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint will be in blocking and scanning suspicious files.
name: cloudBlockLevel

settingDescription: Determines whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically:
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: automaticDefinitionUpdateEnabled

settingDescription: Determines whether suspicious samples (that are likely to contain threats) are sent to Microsoft. You are prompted if the submitted file is likely to contain personal information.
keywords: Microsoft Defender - Cloud delivered protection preferences
name: automaticSampleSubmission

settingDescription: Specifies if network protection is disabled, in audit mode, or enforced
name: enforcementLevel

settingDescription: Specifies the behavior of RTP on mount point marked as nonexec.
name: nonExecMountPolicy

settingDescription: Locates and stops malware from installing or running on your device. You can turn off this setting for a short time before it turns back on automatically.
name: enableRealTimeProtection

settingDescription: Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified in the preceding section.
name: threatTypeSettings_item_value

settingDescription: Specifies whether to start a process scan after new security intelligence updates are downloaded on the device.
